page.title: 02RECREATION-GREYHOUND RACING-
page.content: Originally greyhounds ran in packs and were hunting dogs. They were used for coursing hares and were adapted to run on greyhound tracks chasing a mechanical hare.Races are usually about \ km although some greyhounds are adapted to shorter distances and longer distances up to 1km.The N.G.R.C was formed so that all dogs running under their rules would be registered. All greyhounds must be kept to a regular diet and exercised daily, great care must be taken with greyhounds feet and grooming must be done on a daily basis. The feeding of greyhounds is important.Breakfast:milk cereal and egg.Dinner:mid afternoon,at least 1lb of meat either cooked or raw with plenty of vegetables and brown bread mixed in.Very fast greyhounds can be sold for very large sums of money.
